text: The or GSI is the national institution responsible for surveying and mapping the land and geography of Japan. The main offices of GSI are in Tsukuba City of Ibaraki Prefecture. From 1949 through May 2010, it was known as the "Geographical Survey Institute".Komaki, Kasuo. New English Appellation of the Geographical Survey Institute , 5 March 2010; retrieved 2012-2-4. GSI is part of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism. ==Related pages== * List of National Laboratories (Japan) ==References== == Other websites == * Geospacial Information Authority of Japan website , Category:Independent Administrative Institutions of Japan Category:National mapping agencies
title: Geospatial Information Authority of Japan
